text: William J. Hutchinson (1877-date of death unknown), was a Canadian international lawn bowls player who competed in the 1934 British Empire Games. ==Bowls career== At the 1934 British Empire Games he won the silver medal in the pairs event with Alfred Langford. ==Personal Life== He was a superintendent by trade and was resident at the Strand Hotel during the Games along with the most of the other Canadian bowlers. ==References== Category:Canadian male bowls players Category:Bowls players at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games silver medallists for Canada Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in lawn bowls Category:1877 births Category:Year of death missing
title: William Hutchinson (bowls)
